conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics to find heat absorbed.
First law: ΔU = Q - W, where Q is heat added, W is work done.
Line segment AB is parallel to the V-axis.
AB parallel to V-axis indicates isothermal process.
Work done by gas from A to B is 10 J.
In isothermal process for ideal gas, ΔU = 0.
With ΔU = 0, first law simplifies to Q = W.
Heat absorbed by gas is 10 J.
